qas.question: Which monarch required landlords to post a sign if they wanted to sell ale?
In what year did the king demand ale-sellers post signage on pain of forfeiture?
What was William Shakespeare's father's first name?
If an ale-seller refused to post a sign, what punishment would he receive?

context: In <a1_0>1393<a1_0/> King <a0_0>Richard II<a0_0/> compelled landlords to erect signs outside their premises. The legislation stated "Whosoever shall brew ale in the town with intention of selling it must hang out a sign, otherwise he shall <a4_0>forfeit his ale<a4_0/>." This was to make alehouses easily visible to passing <a3_0>inspectors<a3_0/>, borough ale tasters, who would decide the quality of the ale they provided. William Shakespeare's father, <a2_0>John<a2_0/> Shakespeare, was one such inspector.
